slides.title: Welcome to Submission Intake
slides.notes: Introduction to Submission Intake and its significance in PolicyCenter.
slides.narration: Welcome to the Introduction to Submission Intake in Guidewire PolicyCenter. As developers, we know that streamlining the submission process is crucial for improving efficiency and accuracy in policy handling. Submission Intake is designed to automate this process by leveraging ACORD forms, and we'll explore how this integration can significantly enhance the workflow.
slides.ocrText:
Introduction to Submission Intake

\

slides.title: Introduction to ACORD Forms
slides.notes: Understanding the role of ACORD forms in insurance submissions.
slides.narration: Before diving into the technical details, it's important to recognize the role of ACORD forms in the insurance industry. These standardized forms are essential for capturing consistent data across various insurance products, and they serve as the backbone for the Submission Intake process we'll be discussing today.

slides.title: Streamlining Submission Creation
slides.originalNotes:
Submission Intake streamlines submission creation in PolicyCenter by uploading a PDF file that contains one or more ACORD forms for creating submissions.

Submission Intake streamlines submission creation in PolicyCenter by uploading a PDF file that contains one or more ACORD forms for creating submissions.
slides.notes:
Submission Intake streamlines submission creation in PolicyCenter by uploading a PDF file that contains one or more ACORD forms for creating submissions.

Submission Intake streamlines submission creation in PolicyCenter by uploading a PDF file that contains one or more ACORD forms for creating submissions.
slides.narration: Submission Intake allows us to streamline the submission creation in PolicyCenter by uploading a PDF file with ACORD forms. This means you can automatically create submissions from these forms without manually entering data, which not only saves time but also minimizes errors. It's a great way to leverage existing industry standards to improve efficiency.

slides.title: Learning Objectives
slides.originalNotes:
Objectives
By the end of this lesson, you should be able to:
Describe the Submission Intake process.
Upload a PDF file with ACORD forms for a single or multiple lines.
View and review the uploaded ACORD forms.
Create submissions from the uploaded ACORD forms.
Explain creation and data mapping of new lines for submission intake.
slides.notes:
Objectives
By the end of this lesson, you should be able to:
Describe the Submission Intake process.
Upload a PDF file with ACORD forms for a single or multiple lines.
View and review the uploaded ACORD forms.
Create submissions from the uploaded ACORD forms.
Explain creation and data mapping of new lines for submission intake.
slides.narration: By the end of this lesson, you will be able to describe the Submission Intake process, upload ACORD forms for single or multiple lines, review these forms, and create submissions from them. We'll also delve into the creation and data mapping of new lines for submission intake, giving you a holistic view of the entire process.

slides.title: Creating Submissions from ACORD Forms
slides.originalNotes:
Creating submissions from ACORD forms
Succeed Insurance receives applications in PDF files containing the ACORD forms for insurance products. The company wants to be able to upload the PDF files to PolicyCenter and create submissions automatically.
slides.notes:
Creating submissions from ACORD forms
Succeed Insurance receives applications in PDF files containing the ACORD forms for insurance products. The company wants to be able to upload the PDF files to PolicyCenter and create submissions automatically.
slides.narration: Imagine a scenario where Succeed Insurance receives applications as PDF files containing ACORD forms. They want to be able to upload these files to PolicyCenter and create submissions automatically. This is where the power of Submission Intake shines, turning what could be a manual and error-prone process into an automated and efficient one.

slides.title: Understanding ACORD Forms
slides.originalNotes:
ACORD forms
ACORD stands for Association for Cooperative Operations Research and Development, a non-profit organization in the insurance industry, which publishes and maintains an archive of standardized forms.

For example, the screenshot shows the form ACORD 125 (Commercial Insurance Application) for the Business Owners line.
slides.notes:
ACORD forms
ACORD stands for Association for Cooperative Operations Research and Development, a non-profit organization in the insurance industry, which publishes and maintains an archive of standardized forms.

For example, the screenshot shows the form ACORD 125 (Commercial Insurance Application) for the Business Owners line.
slides.narration: ACORD, which stands for the Association for Cooperative Operations Research and Development, is a non-profit dedicated to standardizing forms in the insurance sector. For instance, the ACORD 125 form is used widely for commercial insurance applications, ensuring that all necessary data is captured consistently. This standardization is key to efficient submissions.

slides.title: The Submission Intake App
slides.originalNotes:
The Submission Intake app
App Reader is a micro-service that converts PDF documents into structured data and has been successfully used by under writing management customers for more than a decade.

But integrating App Reader to PolicyCenter used to be a non- trivial undertaking that required custom integration (no standard solution) and a separate user interface for review (or no user interface).

Submission Intake solves those problems by providing a new user interface that is directly embedded in PolicyCenter Cloud and also has some powerful new features to make the intake process even more efficient.

Since Submission Intake is an embeddable Jutro micro-app,
It is embedded in PolicyCenter via an iframe and that requires Single Sign On to be enabled in PolicyCenter.
Customers that license it do have the option of embedding it in the digital applications, for example Producer Engage.

Submission Intake solves those problems by providing a new user interface that is directly embedded in PolicyCenter Cloud and also has some powerful new features to make the intake process even more efficient.

This integration simplifies the intake process and provides a user-friendly interface, enhancing the overall user experience.

slides.title: The Submission Intake Process
slides.originalNotes:
The submission intake process
The intake process includes the following steps:
Upload the ACORD forms in PDF format.
View the uploaded ACORD forms.
Review the uploaded files and correct any errors.
Create submissions.
slides.notes:
The submission intake process
The intake process includes the following steps:
Upload the ACORD forms in PDF format.
View the uploaded ACORD forms.
Review the uploaded files and correct any errors.
Create submissions.
slides.narration: The Submission Intake process involves several key steps: uploading the ACORD forms in PDF format, viewing these uploaded forms, reviewing them for errors, and finally, creating submissions. Each step is designed to ensure accuracy and efficiency, making the entire process smoother for both developers and users.

slides.title: Uploading ACORD Forms
slides.originalNotes:
Uploading the ACORD forms in PDF format
You can upload the ACORD forms in PDF format from the following places:
• The Uploaded ACORD Documents page on the Desktop in PolicyCenter, as shown in the screenshot.
• The Upload ACORD Documents tab on the New Submissions page of an account in PolicyCenter- This will be discussed later in this lesson.

During the upload, Submission Intake uses AppReadeds optical character recognition (OCR) to extract data from an ACORD PDF, and then transforms it into data that can display within Submission Intake.
slides.notes:
Uploading the ACORD forms in PDF format
You can upload the ACORD forms in PDF format from the following places:
• The Uploaded ACORD Documents page on the Desktop in PolicyCenter, as shown in the screenshot.
• The Upload ACORD Documents tab on the New Submissions page of an account in PolicyCenter- This will be discussed later in this lesson.

During the upload, Submission Intake uses AppReadeds optical character recognition (OCR) to extract data from an ACORD PDF, and then transforms it into data that can display within Submission Intake.
slides.narration: You can upload ACORD forms in PDF format from either the Uploaded ACORD Documents page on the Desktop or the New Submissions page of an account in PolicyCenter. During this upload, the Submission Intake utilizes OCR technology through App Reader to extract and transform data, ensuring seamless integration into the system.

slides.title: Viewing Uploaded ACORD Forms
slides.originalNotes:
Viewing the uploaded ACORD forms
After App Reader has finished successfully scanning a document, that document becomes available on the Uploaded ACORD Documents screen on the Desktop, where you can:

Filter the list of documents by entering text into the Search field.
View the document's status and submission details.
Open an uploaded document for review by clicking Review Needed or Review Started in the Status column for that document.
Delete an uploaded document.
slides.notes:
Viewing the uploaded ACORD forms
After App Reader has finished successfully scanning a document, that document becomes available on the Uploaded ACORD Documents screen on the Desktop, where you can:

Filter the list of documents by entering text into the Search field.
View the document's status and submission details.
Open an uploaded document for review by clicking Review Needed or Review Started in the Status column for that document.
Delete an uploaded document.
slides.narration: Once the documents are successfully scanned, they appear on the Uploaded ACORD Documents screen. Here, you can filter and search for specific documents, view their status, and even open them for detailed review. This centralized view makes it easy to manage and track all submissions in progress.

slides.title: Reviewing Uploaded ACORD Forms
slides.originalNotes:
Reviewing the uploaded ACORD forms
On the ACORD Document Review screen, you can view the data in Submission Intake, side by side with the image of the matching ACORD form. You can also review and fix any identified issues with the data.
slides.notes:
Reviewing the uploaded ACORD forms
On the ACORD Document Review screen, you can view the data in Submission Intake, side by side with the image of the matching ACORD form. You can also review and fix any identified issues with the data.
slides.narration: In the ACORD Document Review screen, you can view the extracted data alongside the original ACORD form image. This side-by-side comparison allows for easy identification and correction of any data discrepancies, ensuring that the information transferred into PolicyCenter is accurate and complete.

slides.title: Creating Submissions
slides.originalNotes:
Creating submissions
After you successfully complete the review, the Create Submissions screen appears. On this screen, you can confirm or select the agency, account, and products for the submission. If this information exists in the uploaded PDF, default values are set automatically from the information in the PDE You can change them if necessary. You can click Create Submissions at the bottom of the screen. Submission Intake then submits the submission to PolicyCenter and removes it from the Uploaded ACORD Documents screen.
slides.notes:
Creating submissions
After you successfully complete the review, the Create Submissions screen appears. On this screen, you can confirm or select the agency, account, and products for the submission. If this information exists in the uploaded PDF, default values are set automatically from the information in the PDE You can change them if necessary. You can click Create Submissions at the bottom of the screen. Submission Intake then submits the submission to PolicyCenter and removes it from the Uploaded ACORD Documents screen.
slides.narration: After reviewing the documents, the Create Submissions screen allows you to confirm or select the agency, account, and products for the submission. If this information is present in the uploaded PDF, it’s automatically populated. This automation simplifies the process, allowing you to focus on key decision points before finalizing the submission.

slides.title: Creating Multiple Submissions
slides.originalNotes:
Creating multiple submissions from ACORD forms
If the PDF file includes ACORD forms for multiple lines, you can create multiple submissions for the same account using Submission Intake.
slides.notes:
Creating multiple submissions from ACORD forms
If the PDF file includes ACORD forms for multiple lines, you can create multiple submissions for the same account using Submission Intake.
slides.narration: When dealing with a PDF file that includes ACORD forms for multiple lines, Submission Intake allows you to create multiple submissions for the same account. This feature is particularly useful for complex accounts that require different lines of business, streamlining the process significantly.

slides.originalNotes:
Configuring Submission Intake
The insurer requires that the Submission Intake should support new lines of business and customization of data mapping for the ACORD forms.
slides.notes:
Configuring Submission Intake
The insurer requires that the Submission Intake should support new lines of business and customization of data mapping for the ACORD forms.
slides.narration: For insurers, it's essential that Submission Intake supports new lines of business and allows customization of data mapping for ACORD forms. This flexibility ensures that as your company expands its offerings, the technology can adapt and continue to provide seamless submissions.

slides.title: Submission Intake Configuration
slides.originalNotes:
Submission Intake Configuration
Submission Intake includes default mappings between ACORD form fields and PolicyCenter fields for the supported policy lines. For more details, refer to the latest documentation on Submission Intake overview.

You can use the Submission Intake Configuration application, available from Guidewire Cloud Home, to customize the existing mappings or add configurations for policy lines that have not yet been configured for Submission Intake.

For more information, refer to the Submission Intake Configuration documentation.
slides.notes:
Submission Intake Configuration
Submission Intake includes default mappings between ACORD form fields and PolicyCenter fields for the supported policy lines. For more details, refer to the latest documentation on Submission Intake overview.

You can use the Submission Intake Configuration application, available from Guidewire Cloud Home, to customize the existing mappings or add configurations for policy lines that have not yet been configured for Submission Intake.

For more information, refer to the Submission Intake Configuration documentation.
slides.narration: Submission Intake comes with default mappings for ACORD form fields, but you can customize these using the Submission Intake Configuration application. This tool, available from Guidewire Cloud Home, allows you to adapt the mappings to suit your specific policy lines, ensuring that all data is correctly aligned with your business requirements.

slides.title: Data Mapping Overview
slides.originalNotes:
Data mapping overview
Submission Intake handles mapping for all the non-line- specific data such as account locations and contacts, as well as all the information about the named insured, for example, name, address, FEIN, organization type, and so on.
So even if a customer builds a brand-new line from scratch, they won't have to worry about mapping any of the generic content.

The line-specific data mapping is done via a Kotlin script that is uploaded to Submission Intake Configuratiom
This mapping is from the Submission Intake ACORD JSON data to the line's APD (Advanced Product Designer) structure in PolicyCenter.
For non-APD products, you need to use the "reverse engineering" process to extract the APD representation needed for Submission Intake.
Using the APD representation simplifies the mapping process and ensures that the APIs are available to pass the ACORD data to PolicyCenter.
slides.notes:
Data mapping overview
Submission Intake handles mapping for all the non-line- specific data such as account locations and contacts, as well as all the information about the named insured, for example, name, address, FEIN, organization type, and so on.
So even if a customer builds a brand-new line from scratch, they won't have to worry about mapping any of the generic content.

The line-specific data mapping is done via a Kotlin script that is uploaded to Submission Intake Configuratiom
This mapping is from the Submission Intake ACORD JSON data to the line's APD (Advanced Product Designer) structure in PolicyCenter.
For non-APD products, you need to use the "reverse engineering" process to extract the APD representation needed for Submission Intake.
Using the APD representation simplifies the mapping process and ensures that the APIs are available to pass the ACORD data to PolicyCenter.
slides.narration: Data mapping in Submission Intake covers both non-line-specific data like account details and line-specific data through a Kotlin script. This script maps ACORD JSON data to the APD structure in PolicyCenter, simplifying the integration process. For non-APD products, you'll need to extract the APD representation to ensure compatibility, leveraging the system's API capabilities.

slides.title: Lines of Business Mapped for Submission Intake
slides.originalNotes:
Lines of business mapped for Submission Intake
Submission Intake provides a mapping for many lines of business in PolicyCenter on Guidewire Cloud. This greatly reduces the customer mapping effort, maybe even to zero. Just upload the mapping file in the Submission Intake Configuration app and you're ready to go.

 For Standard Based Template, Guidewire has mapped Commercial Auto, Workers’ Compensation, and Crime. More SBT lines are being added soon, for example, Commercial Property and General Liability.

For Guidewire Go family of lines, General Liability and Commercial Property are mapped currently.
slides.notes:
Lines of business mapped for Submission Intake
Submission Intake provides a mapping for many lines of business in PolicyCenter on Guidewire Cloud. This greatly reduces the customer mapping effort, maybe even to zero. Just upload the mapping file in the Submission Intake Configuration app and you're ready to go.

 For Standard Based Template, Guidewire has mapped Commercial Auto, Workers’ Compensation, and Crime. More SBT lines are being added soon, for example, Commercial Property and General Liability.

For Guidewire Go family of lines, General Liability and Commercial Property are mapped currently.
slides.narration: Submission Intake provides pre-configured mappings for many lines of business, significantly reducing the effort required by customers. Currently, Commercial Auto, Workers’ Compensation, and Crime are among the mapped lines. As Guidewire continues to expand its offerings, more lines will be added, further streamlining the submission process.

slides.title: Summary and Next Steps
slides.originalNotes:
Summary
You can use Submission Intake to upload a PDF file that contains ACORD forms of one or more lines and then review and update the submission data before submitting it to PolicyCenter.
slides.notes:
Summary
You can use Submission Intake to upload a PDF file that contains ACORD forms of one or more lines and then review and update the submission data before submitting it to PolicyCenter.
slides.narration: In summary, Submission Intake is a powerful tool for uploading ACORD forms, reviewing and updating data, and submitting it to PolicyCenter efficiently. As we move forward, our next chapter will introduce ClaimCenter, where we'll explore claims processing and its integration with PolicyCenter. Stay tuned for another deep dive into Guidewire's capabilities.
